summary: Imperative service to open, close and manage drawer instances from anywhere in the app.
recommendations: Requires a `DrawerRoot` to be mounted in the component tree; `DrawerService` communicates with it via pub-sub events.
Use `DrawerService.open(component, options?)` to open any React node as a drawer â€” returns a unique `drawerId` you can store to close it later.
The opened component automatically receives an `onClose` prop injected by the service; use it inside the drawer content to trigger self-close.
Use `DrawerService.close(drawerId)` for targeted closing, or `DrawerService.closeLast()` to close the most recently opened drawer without tracking the id.
Use `DrawerService.openTextEditDrawer(options, drawerOptions?)` and `DrawerService.openMultiSelectDrawer(options, drawerOptions?)` for built-in specialised drawer patterns.
Pass `DrawerProps` as the second argument to `open()` to customise `anchor`, `variant`, `hideBackdrop`, `title` etc. on a per-open basis.
